Fighting Game Community (FGC) Ranking System Explained

Overview: Accurate & Fair Player Rankings for Street Fighter 6

Our FGC ranking system provides an accurate and current reflection of player skill and performance specifically for Street Fighter 6 (SF6). It ranks players based on their top results from sanctioned offline tournaments worldwide, rewarding consistent excellence and recent achievements. You can view the current player rankings here.

How the Ranking System Works

Our system is designed to fairly evaluate player performance by focusing on meaningful tournament results and ongoing competitive form.

Placement-Based Scoring

Players earn points according to their final placement at offline tournaments. Higher placements receive significantly more points, ensuring that top finishes have the greatest impact on rankings.

Best Performances Count

To balance quantity and quality, only each player’s five highest-rated performances are included in their overall ranking. This approach rewards consistent top-level play without favoring players who simply attend a large number of events.

Dynamic Event Valuation

Each tournament's value is dynamically calculated based on multiple factors, including the prestige and history of the tournament, the strength of competition, and the prize money offered.

Additional considerations include the diversity of regional participation and a focus on major tournaments that hold significant prominence within the competitive landscape.

Larger, more prestigious tournaments with stronger player fields and higher stakes carry greater weight in the ranking system. This ensures that success at the most competitive and meaningful events is appropriately rewarded.

Recency Bias for Current Form

The system emphasizes recent tournament results to ensure the rankings accurately represent who is performing best right now. Older results gradually have less influence, keeping the leaderboard fresh and relevant.

Offline Events Only

Rankings are based exclusively on sanctioned offline tournaments. Sanctioned tournaments are offline events that meet specific standards for fairness and competitive integrity.

Data Sources & Verification

We prioritize accurate and reliable data collection from trusted tournament organizers and verified results to maintain the integrity of the rankings. Our commitment ensures that player standings reflect genuine competitive performance.

Global Recognition & Tournament Inclusion

Our ranking system recognizes offline fighting game tournaments from around the world, promoting a diverse and comprehensive competitive landscape.

Tournament organizers interested in having their events evaluated for inclusion in the official list of rated tournaments are encouraged to contact us for consideration.

Regular Updates, Community Transparency & Engagement

Rankings are updated regularly to incorporate the latest tournament results, ensuring the leaderboard remains accurate and timely.

Developed by and for the fighting game community, our ranking algorithms and weighting factors are designed to fairly recognize performance, consistency, and current competitive form.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

  • How are player rankings calculated?

    Rankings are calculated based on a player’s top five performances at sanctioned offline tournaments, factoring in placement, event value, and recency to reflect current competitive form.

  • Can a player’s ranking change if they attend fewer events?

    Yes. Because the system emphasizes recent and top performances, players who compete less frequently can still maintain or improve their ranking by performing well in high-value tournaments.

  • What games are covered by this ranking system?

    Currently, the ranking system covers Street Fighter 6 (SF6) exclusively.

  • How can I suggest improvements or report errors in the rankings?

    We welcome feedback and encourage you to contact us via fgcprankings@gmail.com with any suggestions or corrections.

  • Why aren’t online tournaments included?

    To maintain competitive integrity and fairness, only offline tournaments are considered, as online results can be affected by connectivity and other factors.

  • How often are rankings updated?

    Rankings are updated regularly following major offline events to ensure they reflect the latest competitive results.

  • How can I get my tournament included?

    Tournament organizers can contact us at fgcprankings@gmail.com to request evaluation and inclusion of their events in the ranking system.

  • How can players submit their tournament results?

    Players should work with tournament organizers who submit official results to us. If you notice a tournament result missing or incorrect, please reach out via email.

  • How are disputes or errors handled?

    We review all reported discrepancies carefully and update rankings accordingly to ensure accuracy. If you find an error, please contact us at fgcprankings@gmail.com.

  • What regions or countries are most represented?

    Our rankings reflect a global player base, with events and competitors from multiple regions around the world.

Contact & Feedback

We welcome questions, feedback, and inquiries from the entire fighting game community — whether you’re a tournament organizer interested in having your event considered, a player seeking more information, or a fan wanting to get involved.

Please feel free to reach out to us at fgcprankings@gmail.com. We’re committed to fostering an open and engaged community and look forward to hearing from you.
